COMMENT_TX: $Opening Day at Fenway Park; Gov. Coolidge and Army and Navy officials in attendance; Coolidge threw out first ball
ej,jones104,P,connt901, $Sam Jones ejected by Connolly in an early inning
$Pratt spiked Mays and ripped his shoe causing an argument
ej,pippw101,NYA,P,Interference non-call $Wally Pipp ejected by Connolly; Nallin ruled McInnis safe when he collided with Quinn at 1B and Quinn fell down; the game was delayed 15 minutes
$As ball was folling near the line and Vitt hit it foul so Peckinpaugh kept running for a double
No putout credited for this play in 1919
$Lewis rounded 3B and started home but had to return and Bodie could not get back to 2B
2nd baseman tried to double up runner but hit him in back
$Gainer muffed the ball on the embankment
$Barry made a wild throw to McInnis
$Barry's throw took and unexpected hop and hit Schang on the forehead, knocking him down
$Shean declared out for interfering with Schalk as he tried to throw out Gilhooley on a stolen base attempt
$Gleason switched the batting order because of a team-wide slump; Sam Jones pitched for Boston in spite of his swollen hand
$Schang out on hidden ball trick to end game
Picinich ejected for arguing strike call.
McInnis overran second and was thrown out.
$Red Sox claimed Baker's popup should have been infield fly
$Scott was hurt in the collision with Peck
$Ruth crashed into the fence trying to catch Pipp's foul fly and was knocked out briefly
$Weaver lost the ball in the sun $Overflow crowd on the field restrained by police on foot & horseback
Liebold was caught off 1B and Schalk tried to score
$Ruth was picked off 1B and Roth tried to score
$the ball struck Weaver on the right eye
Rest of game from 8/20 Boston Globe and Retrosheet box.
